channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023111276
item.description:
Report X-2023111276

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: TEMECULA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/6/2023 at approximately 1202, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 154002 at the station location in Temecula, reporting a package spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing two plastic cans overpacked into another fiberboard box. One of the plastic containers spilled due to a loose cap. Further inspecttion revealed that the inner fiberboard was labeled with Class 8 hazard label. An online safety data sheet futher classified the shipment as UN 2491. The outer package was not marked and labeled per IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023110966
item.description:
Report X-2023110966

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded on to a straight truck, however it was soon found to be leaking. The package was starting to have a reaction and been quickly removed from the truck. A neutralizer was used to stop the reaction and the package had been inspected. It was found that 2 of the bottle's caps had not been secured. The pack had been placed and sealed in a hazardous bin due to the package producing an orange like gas. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a bag and hazardous bin

item.title: Report X-2023110010
item.description:
Report X-2023110010

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPRR employee reported a strong odor emitting from bowl track 40, Roseville Yard, with LPG tank cars. TILX 300895 was found with an odor coming from the protective housings. TILX 300895: ?B end? Liquid Valve was partially open; the plug was less then tool tight and did not create a seal. 1 liquid cup of LPG released from the plug threads. Closing the valve stopped the release. The plug threads were cleaned, new Teflon was applied, and the plug was secured to the valve. Old Seal 00048873, New Seal 0000284.

  • Description: UPRR employee reported a strong odor emitting from bowl track 40, Roseville Yard, with LPG tank cars. TILX 308616 was found with an odor coming from the protective housings. TILX 308616: ?A end? Liquid Valve was partially open; the plug was tool tight but did not create a seal. 1 liquid cup of LPG released from the plug threads. Closing the valve stopped the release. The plug threads were cleaned, new Teflon was applied, and the plug was secured to the valve. Old Seal 00048872, New Seal 0000282.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at the unload. the bucket was leaking liquid and had a small puncture at the bottom of the bucket. DescribePack: the bucket has a small puncture that was leaking liquid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote lined with a hazardous materials bag and taken to the HMPA for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023111201
item.description:
Report X-2023111201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found package in the back of van line 3 in our station. I put on gloves and started to inspect he package to see what was wrong with it. I discovered that the cap was loose why the container inside started leaking and caused inner and outer leakage. I then place damaged package into a red hazmat been with a liner inside. Then brought it to cage 1 to work. DescribePack: I found that the 2.5 gallon of cleaner had a loose cap which caused the bottle to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed damaged package into a red hazmat bin with liner to stop spillage. I checked the surrounding area to make sure damage package didn't leak on any other packages or was on floor.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the outer container on the end of the IC belt. Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote and taken for inspection. Upon inspection we found one of the two bottles had a crack on the upper body causing it to leak approx. 4.oz on to the outer container. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: One of the two bottles had a crack on the body causing it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one case of Klean Strip Stripper (un1090) was crushed by other freight due to improper blocking and bracing and that one of the inner metal one gallon can had released 2 quarts of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023110973
item.description:
Report X-2023110973

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage Hazmat happened in the preload shift. QA manager informed PM Admins about this damage. Package was unloaded with leakage and cleaned and placed into the cage. DescribePack: The packaging looks like it had a loose cap which came loose and leaked all over the package. No holes are anything were on the plastic container DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The package was isolated and placed into the cage upon discovery. Leakage was then cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2023110806
item.description:
Report X-2023110806

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package is a 5 Gallon drum with a removable lid and a metal swinging handle. This handle had a sharp end and this caused the body to be pierced and create a hole big enough for the liquid to spill DescribePack: A 1 cm diameter of hole was created on the body, where the metal handle rest. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined drum and any spill was wiped down with an absorbent pad. The package was then sent in the HMPA to be processed.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was submitted in a plastic lined container as soon as 2 visible dents were discovered while the package was being sorted for loading. DescribePack: 2 visible dents can be seen on the same side of the drum. One where the lid is located, and the other is at the seam of the base and the body meets. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was immediately placed in a plastic lined container and any spill was wiped dry with an absorbent pad.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment underside of box was discolored and wet form internal spillage and was removed from the sort stream inside a plastic lined container. DescribePack: The bottle body was broken in at least two places, one near the neck where the top had been broken off , and on the side , where cracks were traversing the surface area of the container. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The shipment was removed and placed into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

item.title: Report E-2023110486
item.description:
Report E-2023110486

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HUB GROUP ASSOCIATES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 02, 2023, at 1147 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Hub Group personnel in Bloomington, California regarding the release of approximately (30) gallons of F-204, Liquid Alkaline Foam Cleaner and Degreaser UN3266 Corrosion Liquid, Basic, Inorganic, N.O.S., (Sodium Silicate), 8, III Cleaning Compound, 55 from (6) 5-gallon poly pails. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to a 16' x 7' area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to clean the release without complication. All waste generated was containerized in (2) 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite by contractors in preparation for proper disposal.

  • Description: It was reported that due to a nail puncture, approximately 2 ounces of ZEP Con Ind Purple Degreaser (hazardous - UN3266) was released. The released product was contained to the box container and did not impact the dock floor. The terminal advised they felt comfortable donning the proper PPE per SDS, placing the damaged container into a 10 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10 liters of blue raspberry flavor (UN1197) were released from one 20-liter plastic pail. The release impacted the concrete dock. The spill was due to improper loading. The SDS was reviewed with terminal personal and it was determined that the terminal staff are capable of cleaning the release with PPE on site. (1) 15 Gallon metal drum containing product, PPE, and Oil dri was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110269
item.description:
Report E-2023110269

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee at Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Fremont, CA was moving two 55 gal drums to load onto a trailer with a forklift. The forklift had a double drum attachment which was used to pick up and move the drums. The employee raised the forklift but he failed to lift the drums high enough which resulted in one of the drum being smashed between the drum attachment stabilizing bar and the trailer floor frame. This resulted in one of the drums being crushed and causing a leak. Another employee got on the forklift and quickly brought the drums down to the ground and disengaged the drum grabber so that the drum could be tilted to the side to minimize the spill. Other Veolia employees quickly grabbed absorbent and contained the spill. The damaged drum was placed into an 85 gal poly salvage drum and absorbent was used to cleaned the area. Pressure washer was used to decontaminated the affected area. The spilled occurred on asphalt and did not result in release to the environment.

The SDS was reviewed and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on-site. item.title: Report X-2023110280
item.description:
Report X-2023110280

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: SYLMAR
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM TRAILER WHEN UNLOADER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WET FROM BOTTOM. UNLOADER RELEASED IT PROMPTLY ONTO BULK SLIDE. SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RESPONDERS IMMEDIATELY. RESPONDER RESPONDED AND SAW TWO DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS. REFERRED TO DESISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER CHECKED ACIDITY WITH PH TAPE. ACCORDING TO THE RESPONSE SHEET, NEUTRALIZED THE SPILL USING ZEP ABSORBENT AND SODIUM BICARBONATE. ONCE NEUTRALIZED, CLEANED THE SPILL WITH BROOM AND PLASTIC DUST-PAN FROM BULK SLIDE AND FLOOR.

item.title: Report X-2023101245
item.description:
Report X-2023101245

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A pallet of paint cans was moved onto the dock. While on the dock, an unknown forklift operator struck and punctured a can with a ~forklift. The manager on site was able to scoop most of the spill into a containment drum, however sometime after, someone moved it ~out near the dumpster, leaving a tra il across the dock, down the ramp, and across the yard to the dumpster.
